The fragrance dispenser of claim 2, wherein:the cartridge connector comprises a support element configured to be stationary relative to the housing, an engagement element movably connected to the support element, and a biasing member configured to bias the engagement element away from the support element;when the cartridge is in the first position:the cartridge is engaged with the support element and abuts against the engagement element; andthe biasing member is in an energized state; andwhen the cartridge is in the second position:the cartridge is disengaged from the support element.

6. The fragrance dispenser of claim 2, wherein said determining that the criteria is satisfied comprises:determining an amount of time the cartridge has been in use; anddetermining that said amount of time is greater than or equal to a threshold.

7. The fragrance dispenser of claim 6, wherein:the fragrance dispenser further comprises a cartridge sensor for determining that the cartridge has engaged the cartridge connector;the controller comprises a timer configured to activate upon determination that the cartridge has engaged the cartridge connector; andthe controller is configured to determine said amount of time that the cartridge has been in use based on said timer.

8. The fragrance dispenser of claim 2, further comprising an occupancy sensor configured to determine whether a space in which the fragrance dispenser is located is occupied, wherein the controller is configured to control operation of the motor based on said determination made by the occupancy sensor.

9. The fragrance dispenser of claim 2, wherein the fragrance dispenser is configured such that:when the motor rotates in a first rotational direction, the impeller rotates with the motor; andwhen the motor rotates in a second rotational direction, the cartridge is disengaged from the cartridge connector.
10. The fragrance dispenser of claim 2, wherein said opening is located at the lower end of the housing.

11. A fragrance dispenser comprising:a housing comprising an interior;a cartridge configured to be installed at least partially within the interior of the housing, the cartridge comprising a fan having one or more blades, at least one of the one or more blades comprising a fragrant material; anda motor configured to be operably coupled to the fan of the cartridge, wherein the motor is configured to cause the fan to rotate thereby dispensing fragrance from the fragrant material to an ambient environment outside of the interior of the housing.

12. The fragrance dispenser of claim 11, wherein the fragrance dispenser is configured such that:when the motor rotates in a first rotational direction, the fan rotates with the motor;when the motor rotates in a second rotational direction, the cartridge moves from a first position to a second position; anda greater portion of the cartridge is positioned outside of the interior of the housing when the cartridge is in the second position than when in the first position.
13. The fragrance dispenser of claim 11, wherein said fan comprises an impeller having a plurality of blades.

14. The fragrance dispenser of claim 13, further comprising a shaft coupled between the motor and the impeller, wherein the impeller comprises a cavity configured to receive the shaft with an interference fit.

15. The fragrance dispenser of claim 11, further comprising a cartridge connector configured to removably engage the cartridge and a controller configured to control operation of the motor, and wherein the fragrance dispenser is configured such that, in response to the controller determining that a criteria is satisfied, the cartridge is disengaged from the cartridge connector and moves from a first position to a second position, wherein a greater portion of the cartridge is positioned outside of the interior of the housing when the cartridge is in the second position than when in the first position.

16. The fragrance dispenser of claim 15, wherein said determining that the criteria is satisfied comprises:determining an amount of time the cartridge has been in use; anddetermining that said amount of time is greater than or equal to a threshold.

17. A fragrance dispenser comprising:a housing comprising an interior; anda cartridge configured to be installed at least partially within the interior of the housing, the cartridge comprising a fragrant material;wherein the fragrance dispenser is configured such that, in response to determining that a criteria is satisfied, the cartridge moves from a first position to a second position, wherein a greater portion of the cartridge is positioned outside of the interior of the housing when the cartridge is in the second position than when in the first position.

18. The fragrance dispenser of claim 17, further comprising:a cartridge connector configured to engage the cartridge when the cartridge is in the first position;a fan positioned within said cartridge and having one or more blades;a motor configured to be coupled to the fan when the cartridge is in the first position; anda controller configured to instruct the motor to cause the fan to rotate to dispense fragrance from the fragrant material to an ambient environment outside of the interior of the housing, wherein the controller is configured to determine that said criteria is satisfied.

19. The fragrance dispenser of claim 18, wherein the fragrance dispenser is configured such that:when the motor rotates in a first rotational direction, the fan rotates with the motor;when the motor rotates in a second rotational direction, the cartridge moves from the first position to the second position.

20. The fragrance dispenser of claim 18, wherein said determining that the criteria is satisfied comprises determining an amount of time the cartridge has been in use and determining that said amount of time is greater than or equal to a threshold.
21. The fragrance dispenser of claim 18, wherein at least one of the one or more blades of the fan comprises the fragrant material.
